Research Focus: Head and neck cancer survivorship, functional outcomes following treatment, and innovative approaches to surgical reconstruction. Specialized expertise in neck disability assessment, swallowing function optimization, and the application of engineering principles to medical research and clinical practice.

RESEARCH & SCHOLARLY WORK

RESEARCH THEMES

Head and Neck Cancer Outcomes
Investigation of functional outcomes, survivorship, and quality of life in head and neck cancer patients, with particular focus on: • Post-treatment neck disability and swallowing function • Pain management and its impact on treatment efficacy • Development of objective assessment tools using imaging and clinical metrics
Surgical Innovation and Engineering Applications
Integration of engineering principles with surgical practice: • Biomechanical evaluation of surgical techniques • Development of quantitative assessment tools for surgical outcomes • Application of process optimization to clinical workflows
Clinical Microbiology and Biofilm Research
Current investigations focusing on: • Virulence expression in tracheostomy-associated Pseudomonas • Biofilm formation and treatment in head and neck infections • Development of novel therapeutic approaches

ACTIVE RESEARCH PROJECTS

Pseudomonas Virulence Expression in Tracheostomy Patients
Principal Investigator: Dr. Rapsinski Role: Co-Investigator Status: Active Key Components: • Characterization of virulence factor expression • Clinical correlation studies • Development of targeted therapeutic strategies
GLP1 Inhibitors Effect on OSA with Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulators
Collaboration with Dr. Kaffenberger Status: In Development Focus: Impact assessment of GLP1 inhibitors on sleep apnea outcomes
Endotracheal Tube Cuff Pressure-Volume Dynamics
Principal Investigator Status: Active Focus: Quantitative comparison of commercial airway simulators with cadaveric models
